Diary Entry: Morning visit. Gained entry using key safe and announced arrival. Greeted warmly - appeared well-rested and in positive mood. Consent obtained before providing personal care. Supported with washing and dressing - chose own outfit for the day. Skin integrity checked during care - no concerns, skin intact and healthy. Assisted with mobility using walking frame as per care plan. Breakfast prepared as requested - porridge with honey and cup of tea. Good appetite, ate full portion. Morning medication administered as prescribed, taken with water. Engaged in pleasant conversation about plans for the week. Call bell and phone within reach. No concerns to report. Goodbyes exchanged, premises secured on exit.

Lunchtime visit. Arrived and announced presence. Found sitting comfortably in lounge watching television. Consent obtained for all care provided. Assisted to bathroom - mobilised well with walking frame and minimal support. Supported with personal care and continence needs. Prepared lunch as per dietary requirements - chicken soup with bread roll. Ate well, finished entire meal. Good fluid intake throughout visit. Lunchtime medication given as prescribed. Mentioned slight stiffness in shoulder - documented for monitoring and will report to senior. Applied moisturiser to dry areas on arms as requested. Settled comfortably back in chair with blanket. Remote control and drink within reach. In good spirits, looking forward to family phone call later. Door secured on departure.

Tea time visit. Greeted at door - pleased to see staff arrive. Reported having a good day and enjoyed speaking with family on phone. Consent obtained for care. Light personal care provided - wash and change of clothing. Skin checked - all areas intact, no redness or concerns. Tea prepared as preferred - sandwich with salad and fruit. Good appetite, ate most of meal. Encouraged fluids - drank full glass of juice. Evening medication administered as prescribed. Assisted with light tidying of living area as requested. Checked heating and adjusted to comfortable temperature. Emergency pendant tested and working correctly. Settled for the evening with book and radio. No concerns identified during visit. Goodbyes exchanged, all secure on exit.

Bedtime visit. Arrived and greeted warmly. Reported feeling tired but comfortable. Consent obtained for all care. Assisted to bathroom for evening routine - teeth cleaning, washing, and changing into nightwear. Continence care provided. Full skin check completed - noted slight dryness on heels, applied barrier cream as preventative measure. Assisted transfer to bed safely using appropriate equipment as per care plan. Positioned comfortably with pillows for support. Night medication given with water. Glass of water placed on bedside table within easy reach. Night light switched on, curtains closed. Call bell positioned within reach and tested. Room temperature comfortable. Settled and ready for sleep. All windows and doors checked and secure. Goodnight exchanged.

Morning visit. Used key safe for entry, called out on arrival. Found awake and sitting up in bed. Greeted cheerfully - stated slept well overnight. Consent obtained before care. Assisted with morning personal care routine - supported with washing and oral hygiene. Encouraged independence where possible - managed to wash face and hands with verbal prompts only. Dressed in chosen clothes for the day. Skin inspection during care - all intact, no pressure areas. Assisted with safe transfer from bed to wheelchair using hoist as per moving and handling plan. Positioned comfortably in chair. Breakfast served - cereal with milk and toast with marmalade. Ate well with good appetite. Morning medication administered. Engaged in conversation about favourite television programmes. In positive mood. No concerns. Premises secured on leaving.
